intro: Pouzolzia australis, commonly known as the Australian pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Pouzolzia australis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
